CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 1, reads: " Map Register - Vote Plans - Following their smashing victory in May 20 primary election, which saw their forces carry the regular endorsed Democratic ticket, headed by Mayor David L. Lawrence and Gov. George M. Leader, to victory, the Fifth Ward leadership, headed by Ward Chairman Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, met last weekend and made plans for a big Register-and-Vote Campaign. Left to right: Councilman Paul F. Jones, Constable Tommy Smith, chairman of the campaign; Mr. Williams, Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald and Leroy Irvis, one of the victorious legislative candidates over the David B. Roberts-backed incumbents in the First District.  The drive got under way Tuesday. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Councilman Paul F. Jones, Constable Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith, Robert E. "Pappy" Williams, Alderman Harry Fitzgerald, and K. Leroy Irvis standing on right, posed in room with display case of labeled figurines, for voter registration meeting, another version
